author: Nick Nairn
method: Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Heat the olive oil in a pan and fry the onion and garlic for 2-3 minutes, or until softened. Stir in the tomato and ketchup and simmer for 3-4 minutes, or until reduced slightly.  Spread the tomato mixture onto one side of the pitta halves, arrange the pepper strips on top and lay over the cheese. Transfer to a baking sheet and bake in the oven for 3-4 minutes, or until the cheese starts to melt. Serve the pitta bread pizzas on a serving plate alongside the shredded iceberg lettuce.
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil,  ½ onion, finely chopped,  1 garlic clove, crushed,  1 tomato, seeds removed, chopped,  4 tbsp tomato ketchup,  3 mini pitta breads, split in half horizontally,  ½ yellow pepper, seeds removed, cut into strips,  ½ red pepper, seeds removed, cut into strips,  55g/2oz Manchego cheese, sliced,  1 handful iceberg lettuce, shredded, to serve
